revised_title: Earth's Expansion and Continental Displacement During Mesozoic and Cenozoic
tldr: The authors argue that the Earth has expanded by 20% of its current diameter during the last 180-200 million years, leading to better fits of continental fragments and more accurate representation of the Earth's surface. This expansion is supported by ocean floor spreading data and has significant implications for the distribution of marine life and the understanding of the Earth's history.
